title: Getting a repository from someone
contents:
You can get a repository by using the ``clone`` command:
```console
$ git clone <remote url>
```
This will clone the directory and put in the current directory, so you can start working on the repository.
The default name of the remote is origin, which can be specified with the  -o option `git clone -o booyah` . creating remote branch called `booyah/master` and the `master` branch:
![|400](https://git-scm.com/book/en/v2/images/remote-branches-1.png)
